before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"f6jvc","text":"Our benchmarks can be reproduced in any Docker-complaint platform, such as Windows, MacOS or any Linux-based system by following a similar setup to that introduced herein. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu0ue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o3s1","text":"In order to obtain a decrypt password for downloading the required files, you should sign and obtain a license for the National Library of Medicine (NLM) of the United States to use the UMLS Metathesaurus databases, as well as SNOMED-CT and MeSH ontologies included in this Docker image. For this purpose, you should go top the NLM license page, https://uts.nlm.nih.gov//license.html. After that, you could write to eciencia@consorciomadrono.es to obtain the password to decrypt the file. Likewise, you should obtain and sign a Data User Agreement from the Mayo Clinic to use the MedSTS dataset by sending the authors the Data User Agreement form, https://n2c2.dbmi.hms.harvard.edu/data-use-agreement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7021n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tpvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1999l","text":"This protocol introduces a set of reproducibility resources with the aim of allowing the exact replication of the experiments introduced by our main paper [1], which introduces the largest and for the first time reproducible experimental survey on biomedical sentence similarity. HESML V2R1 [2] is the sixth release of our Half-Edge Semantic Measures Library (HESML), which is a linearly scalable and efficient Java software library of ontology-based semantic similarity measures and Information Content (IC) models for ontologies like WordNet, SNOMED-CT, MeSH and GO. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f6s5","text":"This protocol sets a self-contained reproducibility platform which contains the Java source code and binaries of our main benchmark program, as well as a Docker image which allows the exact replication of our experiments in any software platform supported by Docker, such as all Linux-based operating systems, Windows or MacOS. All the necessary resources for executing the experiments are published in the permanent repository [3]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ud0l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgmou","text":"Our benchmark program is distributed with the UMLS SNOMED-CT and MeSH ontologies by courtesy of the US National Library of Medicine (NLM), as well as all needed software components with the aim of making the setup process easier. Our Docker image provides an exact virtual replica of the machine in which we ran our experiments, thus removing the need to carry-out any tedious setup process, such as the setup of the Named Entity Recognizer tools and other software components. (2022-02-20)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce66r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"den4m","text":"[1] Lara-Clares A, Lastra-Díaz JJ, Garcia-Serrano A. A reproducible experimental survey on biomedical sentence similarity: a string-based method sets the state of the art. Submitted to PLoS One. 2022.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lm90","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1emcb","text":"[2] Lara-Clares A, Lastra-Díaz JJ, Garcia-Serrano A. HESML V2R1 Java software library of semantic similarity measures for the biomedical domain. e-cienciaDatos; 2022. doi:10.21950/DOI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6529v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0l9f","text":"[3] Lara-Clares, Alicia; Lastra-Díaz, Juan J.; Garcia-Serrano, Ana, 2021, \"Reproducible experiments on word and sentence similarity measures for the biomedical domain\",https://doi.org/10.21950/EPNXTR, e-cienciaDatos, V2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":168,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":168,"length":31}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"683E7C7F90C011EC84BC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.21950/EPNXTR"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4q0l","text":"The Docker image provides all software pre-installed, which means that it is not necessary to install them to reproduce the results of this paper. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: hesml, sentence similarity, semantic similarity, ontologies, bert
manuscript_citation: Lara-Clares A, Lastra-Díaz JJ, Garcia-Serrano A. A reproducible experimental survey on biomedical sentence similarity: a string-based method sets the state of the art. Submitted to PLoS One. 2022.
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"apkr1","text":"All the required materials to reproduce the experiments in this protocol are published in our reproducibility dataset","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as1mp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"58pod","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9gb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7015","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Lara-Clares, Alicia; Lastra-Díaz, Juan J.; Garcia-Serrano, Ana","can_edit":1,"date":1645056000,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.21950/EPNXTR","guid":"AC5DED0090C011EC8B5FF35FBF897475","id":1573,"journal":"e-cienciaDatos, V2","protocol_id":null,"title":"Reproducible experiments on word and sentence similarity measures for the biomedical domain"}}}}

references.title: Reproducible experiments on word and sentence similarity measures for the biomedical domain
references.authors: Lara-Clares, Alicia; Lastra-Díaz, Juan J.; Garcia-Serrano, Ana

references.title: A reproducible experimental survey on biomedical sentence similarity: a string-based method sets the state of the art
references.authors: Lara-Clares A, Lastra-Díaz JJ, Garcia-Serrano A.

steps.section: Create and run a Docker container with HESML and dependencies
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ldok","text":"In this step, we create and run a Docker container which have pre-installed all the necessary software for executing the experiments. Creates a table with the LiBlock NER experiments which is used to detail the p-values in table 12 of the main paper table with the NER experiments which is used to detail the p-values in table 11 of the main paper [1].","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vhq4","text":"bio_analytics_biosses.R, bio_analytics_medsts.R and bio_analytics_ctr.R: Creates the figure 5 and is used to create the tables 13-17 of our primary paper Now, the post-processing experiments are evaluated in the local machine, under the HESML_DATA directory. You can detach the HESMLV2R1 docker container by clicking the key sequence: CTRL+p, CTRL+q","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10011,"name":"cd [PATH_TO_HESML_DATA_DIRECTORY]/HESML_DATA \u0026\u0026 sudo chmod -R 777 ReproducibleResults/","os_name":"Ubuntu","os_version":"20.04","command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"2862396090BC11EC8B5FF35FBF897475"}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"384nn","text":"The \"bio_sentence_sim_scripts\" directory contains a set of R scripts to parse the output raw files created by the execution of HESMLSTSclient and HESMLSTSImpactPreprocessinclient. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"4":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"sdbq","text":"The execution of all the R scripts listed below produces a ser of TXT and CSV files containing all the post-processed results, which are used to create tables 8, 10-17, figure 5 and appendices A and B of our primary paper [1]. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: UBUNTU-based instructions to run our benchmarks on a Docker container
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eaiet","text":"[OPTIONAL] Running the pre-processing experiments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu2m6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gmbj","text":"In our primary paper [1], we also evaluate the pre-processing configurations of each method, which are detailed in tables 7 and 9, as well as the appendix B of the same paper. This pre-processing experiments are evaluated using the HESMLSTSImpactPreprocessingclient software included in the HESML V2R1 software release [6].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abf4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egfu9","text":"[6] Lara-Clares A, Lastra-Díaz JJ, Garcia-Serrano A. HESML V2R1 Java software library of semantic similarity measures for the biomedical domain. e-cienciaDatos; 2022. doi:10.21950/DOI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ms9c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69ciu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"208c","text":"To execute the pre-processing experiments, run the following command","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek0br","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7isql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e5cvs","text":"It is important to note that the execution of the pre-processing experiments requires high computational requirements and running times (more than 2 weeks), since they perform more than 1100 pre-processing combinations in total.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10010,"name":"cd /home/user/HESML/HESML_Library/HESMLSTSImpactEvaluationclient/ \u0026\u0026 java -jar -Xms30g dist/HESMLSTSImpactEvaluationclient.jar","os_name":"Docker version 20.10.12","os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":"","can_edit":1,"guid":"CC193D2090B111EC8B5FF35FBF897475"}}}}
